items.title: Leveraging tax credits and incentives for sustainability projects

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Randa Barsoum of PwC US highlights tax credits and incentives beyond the familiar energy incentives that can support sustainability initiatives. She points to state and local abatements, location-based incentives, and R&D tax credits tied to innovation in areas like reimagining packaging or processes, with the key message that a broader view of tax opportunities can unlock meaningful value from sustainability investments.
bullets: Energy incentives are commonly considered but arenâ€™t the whole picture.
State and local abatements can support sustainability projects.
Location-based incentives are another often-overlooked lever.
R&D tax credits apply to innovation efforts (e.g., reimagining packaging or processes).
Viewing sustainability investments broadly can generate meaningful tax value.
takeaways: Donâ€™t rely solely on energy incentivesâ€”investigate state/local abatements when planning projects or site selection.
Assess location-based incentives as part of your facility and expansion decisions.
Explore R&D tax credits for innovation in processes that improve sustainability and may qualify for credits.
Frame sustainability investments to capture tax value across multiple incentive types.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Naseema McElroy, 44, is a labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California who also runs a personal finance brand and holds three jobs in the Bay Area, bringing in $251K a year. After accumulating nearly $1 million in debt in 2015, she started Financially Intentional to document her debt-payoff journey and was debt-free by 2017.
bullets: Labor and delivery nurse and founder of the personal finance brand Financially Intentional
Earns $251K per year through three jobs in the Bay Area
Accumulated nearly $1M in debt in 2015
Documented her debt-payoff journey and became debt-free by 2017
Profiled in CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series
takeaways: Diversified income streams can materially increase financial resilienceâ€”consider multiple revenue sources for operational stability.
Documenting and sharing processes can build a recognizable brand and open new revenue channels.
Aggressive financial discipline and focused payoff strategies free up resources for investment or growth.
Side projects can be scaled into full-fledged businesses that complement primary operations.
